adrFormatAddress: 1030 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA

editorialSummary.text: Mellow, dimly lit cafe & bakery selling cappuccino, croissants & Eastern European treats.

originalText.text: Smells heavenly in here! It‚Äôs warm, cozy, everything I‚Äôve tried in this shop has been incredible. I usually go here in the morning with my boyfriend to do crossword puzzles with lattes and some lovely pastries. It sure gets busy so don‚Äôt be afraid to just grab a seat next to someone! Highly recommend the cheese pastries and croissants, have yet to try their cakes!

originalText.text: This place is seriously overrated. I was so excited, instead I was honestly shockedüò≥ It‚Äôs simply DIRTY and the pastries are old/poor quality!üòµ‚Äçüí´ Don‚Äôt believe me? Go and see yourself! Although I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this place to a friend! There is nothing authentic Hungarian being baked there. I bought several pastries and they were awful. Don‚Äôt be fooled by the appearance. The poppy seed strudel was just hard I couldn‚Äôt even cut I with a knife. The Isler (Ishler) supposed to be filled with jelly, however, there it‚Äôs filled with at least an inch cheap chocolate creme. The other cake with apricot jelly? (I don‚Äôt even know what it was cause the lady at the register couldn‚Äôt even explain) tasted simply odd! Also bought cookies and the almond horn to go, it was oldü•¥ also, no descriptions or prices at the pastries. Why?! The only menu on the wall which leaves you guessing what is what looks like it‚Äôs 100 years old and should be updated with prices. To top it off: I grabbed two glasses at the water station, both of them were completely dirty with lipstick from previous customers, first I thought I grabbed mistakenly the used ones but nope, those were the ‚Äúclean‚Äù onesü§¢ (I should have taken a picture but I simply left disgusted) Won‚Äôt be back!

originalText.text:
The by the pound cookies are what I recommend, grab to go and bring to the park! I think it's not worth a wait if the line is out the door, but when I'm there and the line is contained inside I always grab to go

Add on: maple cookies are amazing! They are in the by the pound section if they have them. Delightfully maple tasting and not too sweet! Unique and delicious!

text.text:

originalText.text: Stopped by here on a Thursday morning to grab a snack during our walk and this was literally the best croissant and cheese danish I have ever had. It was soft and buttery and I am waiting to come back and have it again. I know the lines here are long on the weekends but at this time, there was just a short one!

text.text: Stopped by here on a Thursday morning to grab a snack during our walk and this was literally the best croissant and cheese danish I have ever had. It was soft and buttery and I am waiting to come back and have it again. I know the lines here are long on the weekends but at this time, there was just a short one!

originalText.text: A really fun and iconic shop near Columbia serving lots of traditional and delicious pastries! The inside is usually always busy but I‚Äôve always been able to grab a seat despite the business. Don‚Äôt be turned off if there‚Äôs a long line, it always moves pretty fast
